> BIC:
> 
> Tucson nods and turns to get ready for a little alone time wi=
th Talon.
> 
> Yet he turns back to Wheelie.
> 
> " If that's what you want=
, that's fine by me, Wheelie.  But keep in mind, it doesn't hurt to have a =
friend as well as a comrade by your side. I learned that many vorns ago whe=
n I started working with the Autobots.  And yes war is a difficult time and=
 we can not weaken our defenses but, it doesn't mean we have to be anti soc=
ial either.  Strength is in numbers.  That was one of Master Yokitron's wor=
ds."
> 
> Tucson backs into his private quarters and closes the door softly=
.
> 

<NEW>

Wheelie paused, "Who was this YOketron, and why should I care =
what he had on?  If he had words, then fine to this day.  But they don't ma=
tter not to one who does not hede them anyway."

Then, going to head off to=
wards the other corridors of the ship, intent on something that the small c=
arbot would do when he was alon e and over with himself.
